result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Dexter Hale in court with attorney Thomas j Kasen.  Defendant Dexter Hale in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson.
BTC:

13CF727
Count 4- 4 Years WPS, 2 Years ic, 2 Years es, to run consecutive to any other sentence, i/s, 3 Years Probation

Count 12- 4 Years WPS, 2 Years ic, 2 Years es, i/s, 3 Years Probation

15CF1718
Count 2- 4 Years WPS, 3 Years ic, 1 Years es 

Count 3- 2 Years WPS, 1 Year ic, 1 Year es, to run consecutive to count 2

Count 6- 7 Years WPS, 3 1/2 Years ic, 3 1/2 Years es, to run consecutive to count 2 & count 3

15CF1725
Count 1- 2 Years WPS, 1 Year ic, 1 Year es, to run concurrent to 13CF727, i/s, 3 Years Probation

Count 2- 3 Years WPS, 2 Years ic, 1 Year es, to run concurrent to count 1 & 13CF727, i/s, 3 Years Probation

Conditions:
No drugs, no alcohol
No contact with any known drug users or drug dealers
Court costs are waived in all files
Pay domestic violence surcharge in 15CF1725 on count 1 
Provide a DNA Sample & pay surcharge in 13CF727 on count 4, in 15CF1718 on count 2 & in 15CF1725 on count 1
Obtain & maintain employment 
Comply with family court orders
No contact with P.O. unless approved by her and the agent
Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by the agent
FAW
VOTE
Eligible for ERP & CIP

15CF1725: Count 1 as charged & Count 2 - Guilty

15CF1725:  Count 1 as charged & Count 2 -GUILTY; DRI the balance.

Defendant Dexter Hale in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Dexter Hale in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Reading waived.
Preliminary hearing at 11-25-2015 09:00 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Dexter Hale in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Dexter Hale in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. BTC: WARRANT VACATED  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.
